reviewText:
Jonathon Poe (Stelio Savante) interviews and lives with "the Chef" (David Fine) a cannibalistic serial killer. The soundtrack, lighting, acting and plot are designed to place one on a boredom coma.  Part of a 10 pack of DVDs, " Dark Disposition."

Very tough to sit through. Good for 1 punch on the Hacker's card.

Prop nudity.
If you ever want to have a rotten tomatoes marathon...this one would be at the top of the list...

I must thank the Producer/Director Francis Xavier for a screener copy of this film In many ways, This film is an homage to horror film which came before. Most may not get that since many horror prides want a WALKING DEAD type of horror. This is a horror similar to Vincent Price's Diary Of A Madman. In a way, this film seems a throwback to something from the SOMETHING WEIRD catalog of films or from the Inner Sanctum Mysteries: The Complete Movie Collection (Calling Dr. Death / Weird Woman / The Frozen Ghost / Pillow of Death / Dead Man's Eyes / Strange Confession) Director and writer Francis Xavier has crafted a modern day tribute to old time horror. Whereas the film goer is left pondering the lead character's fate. He seems to have three different story-lines intersecting in this film. The Mad Doctor Casey, Jonathon Poe and a third storytelling piece that would spoil the fun if I revealed it here. Those fans of Twilight Zone or Outer Limits know the ideal of a twist in the tail, That is all I will say. It has a great ending twist that you won't forget too soon. One of the acting highlights is David Fine who portrays Doctor Casey (Chef). He steals the film in almost every scene he is in. He has such a Lon Chaney like performance, its over the top with enough breaks to make the audience want more. However to counter balance Mr Fine great acting is the weak performance of Stelio Savante whose brooding Poe drags this film down. This film is many ways is very thought-provoking like a game of chess. However like a game of chess , this film seem disjointed and full of unneeded moves. Watch this and then watch an Inner Sanctum movie and you will see where this homage is a tribute to its source Bennet Pomerantz AUDIOWORLD
I thought I had seen some extremely crappy films in my life, but OMG this POS needs to be burned and buried. Don't waste your cash on this stinker; it's not even good enough to make fun of...
